data.data: Pay for combined life and income protection insurance directly from your mysuper account.
What kind of cover does this give me?

data: Life insurance provides a lump sum payment of three times your annual salary if you die. Income protection cover provides a tax-free monthly benefit equivalent to 50% of your annual salary should you become unable to work due to illness or accident.
If you choose the mysuper insurance add-on within 90 days of joining ACC, any pre-existing conditions will be covered.
This is money that would have gone straight into your savings anyway—no noticeable loss to your day-to-day funds, but a whole lot more peace of mind for you and your loved ones.

data.data: mysuper exists to set up our employees with financial security in the future, and we’ve been doing it.

data: If you’re unable to work due to illness or accident there’s a 13-week stand down period.

If you apply outside of the first 90 days you will need to complete a personal statement and be medically underwritten  for all benefits. Unless you have any underlying health issues this should not affect your premium.
Your premium is based on your age, gender and salary when you take up your cover and is reviewed 1 October each year.
Income protection cover is sometimes referred to as “Salary Continuance Insurance” or “Personal Sickness Insurance” or “Accident insurance”
To determine your insurance protection cover, your annual salary is calculate as at the date of joining, or 1  October each year (whichever is later).
This insurance cover is provided by AMP.
